snippet: A federal judge threw out a suit that said the Broadway play “Hand to God” borrowed excessively from the comedians’ routine.
abstract: Federal judge rules against heirs to Abbott and Costello, who had accused playwright Robert Askins as well as producers and promoters of play Hand to God of copyright infringement for using parts of comedians' Who's on First routine.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge threw out a suit that said the Broadway play “Hand to God” borrowed excessively from the comedians’ routine.

headline.main: Heirs of Abbott and Costello Lose Copyright Claim Over ‘Who’s on First’
headline.print_headline: Abbott and Costello Heirs Lose Lawsuit
